title: Particle motion - finding position given velocity

content.prompt: An object traveling in a straight line has position x ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CB9@ at time t.If the initial position is x ( 0 ) = 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E3C@ and the velocity of the object is v ( t ) = 1 + t 2 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4266@ , what is the position of the object at time t = 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaG4maaaa@3BB7@ ?

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
